meanings.def: at a time in the future; after the time you are talking about
examples: See you later.
I met her again three years later.
His father died later that year.
We're going to Rome later in the year.
She later became a doctor.
I discovered later that she'd known all about it from the beginning.

meanings.def: a way of saying goodbye, used by young people
examples: Later, guys!

meanings.def: at a time in the future; after the time you are talking about
examples: I'm going out later on.
Much later on, she realized what he had meant.

meanings.def: by a particular time and not after it
examples: Please arrive no later than 8 o'clock.

meanings.def: at some time in the future, even if you are not sure exactly when
examples: Sooner or later you will have to make a decision.

meanings.def: after a short time rather than after a long time
examples: We urged them to sort out the problem sooner rather than later.

idioms.def: at a time in the future; after the time you are talking about
examples: I'm going out later on.
Much later on, she realized what he had meant.

idioms.def: by a particular time and not after it
examples: Please arrive no later than 8 o'clock.

idioms.def: at some time in the future, even if you are not sure exactly when
examples: Sooner or later you will have to make a decision.

idioms.def: after a short time rather than after a long time
examples: We urged them to sort out the problem sooner rather than later.

meanings.def: coming after something else or at a time in the future
examples: Rembrandt's later works
This is discussed in more detail in a later chapter.
The judge will give her ruling at a later date.
The match has been postponed to a later date.

meanings.def: near the end of a period of time, life, etc.
examples: the later part of the seventeenth century
In later life he started playing golf.
She found happiness in her later years.
